s2.title: PParse
s2.p: In this example, the programmer doesn't have to depend upon throwing an exception to terminate the parsing operation. Calling parseFirst() will cause the DTD to be parsed (both internal and external subsets) and any pre-content, i.e. everything up to but not including the root element. Subsequent calls to parseNext() will cause one more piece of markup to be parsed, and spit out from the core scanning code to the parser. You can quit the parse any time by just not calling parseNext() anymore and breaking out of the loop. When you call parseNext() and the end of the root element is the next piece of markup, the parser will continue on to the end of the file and return false, to let you know that the parse is done.
